content: Savings Bank Account CIMB FastSaver Asked by AnonymousAsked on 22 Jul 2019Is CIMB FastSaver or POSB SAYE better for a student?Hello, I am student thinking of opening a new savings account to earn higher interest. Can anyone advise me which is better among the 2?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered on 23 Jul 2019CIMB Fastsaver FTW - because of the straight up 1% with no conditions whatsoever!Another no-frills one is the Citibank Maxigain, but for that I believe the minumum amount was $100k or so.0 comments4

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 25 Jul 2019As a student, I am assuming you do not have a job currently.If that assumption is right, then CIMB fastsaver is the better choice. Because POSB SAYE requires salary crediting and you only earn the higher interest on the amount you deposit into SAYE account.  https://www.posb.com.sg/personal/deposits/savings-accounts/saye
CIMB fastsaver is a no frills 1% interest if you have at least 1k.3 comments2

See all 3 comments Gabriel Tham22 Jul 2019Yea, I think CIMB is still better here. Because for POSB SAYE, only the amount you transfer into the SAYE will get the bonus 2% interest. Let's say you earn 1.5k and you put $500 into SAYE, you get interest for that $500. If you make withdrawal within 24 months of opening from this SAYE, you will not be eligible for the bonus interest. 

To prevent lock ups, just go for CIMB.Question Poster25 Jul 2019Thank You!
Kenneth ChanLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 25 Jul 2019CIMB for no frills interest, POSB for higher interest (if you company supports salary crediting).0 comments1
